definition: lit. an arrow at the end of its flight (idiom)/fig. spent force
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
variant of 強|强[jiang4]
variant of 強|强[qiang3]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
variant of 強|强[qiang2]
surname Qiang
stubborn/unyielding
crossbow
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man

sentences.english: We've been a spent bullet for the love.
sentences.chinese: 在情感上已经是强弩之末。

sentences.english: They are not yet a spent force, but time is running out for them very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他们还未到强弩之末，但是时机在快速驱离他们。

sentences.english: But his doctors admit it's a long shot .
sentences.chinese: 然而他的医生承认这是强弩之末。

sentences.english: We have been a spent bullet for the love.
sentences.chinese: 在情感上已经是强弩之末。

definition: to be unable to endure
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
defeated/routed
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
to retreat in defeat
seriously injured
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
to give no cause for anxiety/nothing to worry about
deathbed struggle/final struggle (idiom)
lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
to attack violently/to storm
